body_html:
Just a short note to your screenshot above ☝️ @branquinhoaa: I think it would increase the readability if you'd always add a whitespace 🏳️ between the link and the label.
And for the orga comment, I guess it would make sense to add a linebreak and make the comment a blockquote

For the conference-links: I'd suggest to use a normal list without bullets (I don't see the point for them here...)

For the attendance-links: they're currently not distinguishable from the conference-links, even though they're a totally different call to action (they change state, rather then "just" inform). It would make sense to have this difference somehow visible, e.g. by making them small buttons instead of just links.

However, I don't see a point in always displaying both attendance buttons. What happens when I'm already attending and click "Yes, I can attend" again? I guess something like a toggle button would be more obvious here.
And another concern I have with these buttons: for how long should it be possible to toggle back and forth between attending and not attending? (cc @mkalininait ) 🤔

body:
Just a short note to your screenshot above ☝️ @branquinhoaa: I think it would increase the readability if you'd always add a whitespace 🏳️ between the link and the label.
And for the orga comment, I guess it would make sense to add a linebreak and make the comment a [blockquote](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/3.3/css/#default-blockquote)

For the conference-links: I'd suggest to use a normal [list](https://getbootstrap.com/docs/3.3/css/#unstyled) without bullets (I don't see the point for them here...)

For the attendance-links: they're currently not distinguishable from the conference-links, even though they're a totally different call to action _(they change state, rather then "just" inform)_. It would make sense to have this difference somehow visible, e.g. by making them small buttons instead of just links.

However, I don't see a point in **always** displaying both attendance buttons. What happens when I'm already attending and click `"Yes, I can attend"` again? I guess something like a toggle button would be more obvious here.
And another concern I have with these buttons: for how long should it be possible to toggle back and forth between attending and not attending? _(cc @mkalininait )_ 🤔
